strategy: Apply target encoding to categorical variables (e.g., gender, class, embarkation point) by replacing each category with the mean of the target variable (survival) in that group. This helps capture the underlying relationship between categories and survival, improving model performance without introducing high cardinality issues.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Target encoding for categorical variables
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Pclass', 'Embarked']

# Create target encoding mapping
target_encoding = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    temp = train_df.groupby(col)['Survived'].mean().round(4)
    target_encoding[col] = temp.to_dict()

# Apply target encoding
X_train_encoded = X_train.copy()
X_test_encoded = X_test.copy()

for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train_encoded[col] = X_train_encoded[col].map(target_encoding[col])
    X_test_encoded[col] = X_test_encoded[col].map(target_encoding[col])

# Impute missing values in numerical features (Age, Fare)
X_train_encoded['Age'].fillna(X_train_encoded['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test_encoded['Age'].fillna(X_test_encoded['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train_encoded['Fare'].fillna(X_train_encoded['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test_encoded['Fare'].fillna(X_test_encoded['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns and prepare features
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Identify and handle categorical columns
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Pclass', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']

# Remove non-numeric columns that cause errors
X_train_clean = X_train.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], errors='ignore')
X_test_clean = X_test.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], errors='ignore')

# Target encoding for categorical variables
target_encoding = {}
for col in ['Sex', 'Pclass', 'Embarked']:
    temp = train_df.groupby(col)['Survived'].mean().round(4)
    target_encoding[col] = temp.to_dict()

# Apply target encoding
X_train_encoded = X_train_clean.copy()
X_test_encoded = X_test_clean.copy()

for col in ['Sex', 'Pclass', 'Embarked']:
    X_train_encoded[col] = X_train_encoded[col].map(target_encoding[col])
    X_test_encoded[col] = X_test_encoded[col].map(target_encoding[col])

# Impute missing values in numerical features
numerical_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
for col in numerical_columns:
    X_train_encoded[col].fillna(X_train_encoded[col].median(), inplace=True)
    X_test_encoded[col].fillna(X_test_encoded[col].median(), inplace=True)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns and prepare features
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Identify and handle categorical columns
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Pclass', 'Embarked']

# Remove non-numeric columns that cause errors
X_train_clean = X_train.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], errors='ignore')
X_test_clean = X_test.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], errors='ignore')

# Target encoding for categorical variables
target_encoding = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    temp = train_df.groupby(col)['Survived'].mean().round(4)
    target_encoding[col] = temp.to_dict()

# Apply target encoding
X_train_encoded = X_train_clean.copy()
X_test_encoded = X_test_clean.copy()

for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train_encoded[col] = X_train_encoded[col].map(target_encoding[col])
    X_test_encoded[col] = X_test_encoded[col].map(target_encoding[col])

# Impute missing values in numerical features
numerical_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
for col in numerical_columns:
    X_train_encoded[col] = X_train_encoded[col].fillna(X_train_encoded[col].median())
    X_test_encoded[col] = X_test_encoded[col].fillna(X_test_encoded[col].median())

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
